attributes.action: scrap the Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs (ACMD) which produces (most expensively) recommendations which are at variance with government policy and common sense or resign because of his utter lack of good judgement when appointing people to important positions to review and give advice as to how the country should be run.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This is the second demonstration of his gross lack of good judgement he has given the voters this week.  McBroon is now at variance with both the EU over 'british jobs for british people' AND with one of his own appointed QUANGOs' who are paid to give advice to the government but which advice McBroon seems unable to be able to follow because it is not common sense.  This is no way to run a country and if the ACMD is not to be scrapped then McBroon needs to go to the country to get the opinion of the people paying for this rubbish to find out if they are prepared to continue to pay for it.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
